title: Urgent Safeguarding Breach: Narrative Control, Disclosure, and Loss of Consent
subject: Urgent Safeguarding Breach – Internal Narrative and Third-Party Disclosures
core_quotes: I am writing to formally notify you of a serious safeguarding breach, now confirmed through direct communication from an artist.

Members of the Brighton Fringe team have either directly or indirectly: Shared internal narratives about my mental health and business capacity; Disclosed, reframed, or downplayed private safeguarding information; Justified contact with my ex-partner without informing me, under the guise of 'keeping us apart'.
I have formally revoked consent for PC Jon Dixon to remain involved in my case. I am now under the protection of a new investigating officer, with support from Veritas Justice.
I did not consent to any redistribution of control over Half a Camel Productions. I did not step away — the loss of operational control happened during a safeguarding crisis, without consent.
Any further misrepresentation — or failure to clarify what has already been shared — will be considered formal grounds for legal action and public complaint.

Confirm whether Brighton Fringe has contacted Alanna O’Hare since April 2nd, and on what basis.
Disclose any internal documents/communications about my role, involvement, or state of mind that may have influenced artists’ decisions.
